body_html:
I get the same error. I'm using the code found here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.10/tensorflow/examples/how_tos/reading_data/convert_to_records.py

edit: I've confirmed that I get the same error when using the code found here as well:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/how_tos/reading_data/convert_to_records.py

Like dzhwinter mentioned, removing reshape leads to other errors in the code.

Also, to clarify dzhwinter's original bug report, it's not that the function doesn't take the argument, it's that the argument isn't recognized by the function. If you remove the reshape=False there are other problems.

body:
I get the same error. I'm using the code found here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.10/tensorflow/examples/how_tos/reading_data/convert_to_records.py

edit: I've confirmed that I get the same error when using the code found here as well:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/how_tos/reading_data/convert_to_records.py

Like dzhwinter mentioned, removing reshape leads to other errors in the code.

Also, to clarify dzhwinter's original bug report, it's not that the function doesn't take the argument, it's that the argument isn't recognized by the function. If you remove the reshape=False there are other problems.
